description: False indigo (Baptisia 'Lunar Eclipse') is a unique and showstopping perennial plant. Despite its name, it has no relation to true indigo and boasts beautiful lemon-yellow blooms from summer to late fall. This bold flowering shrub makes an eye-catching statement in all gardens. Its blooms are famously fragrant and attractive to butterflies in the summer, while its smoky blue-green foliage lends a classical air to the garden year round. False indigo is also reliably low-maintenance and is quite deer resistant. Plus, this great showstopper is also highly drought tolerant making it an ideal plant for all gardeners.
